name: Quality Inn & Suites -- South San Francisco

reviews.text: This hotel is my prefer hotel when driving from LA to SF.
reviews.title: Great Place Includes Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I go to the 49ers games about 3-4 times a year and found this nice hotel.
reviews.title: Back For 2nd Time

reviews.text: It's near the 101FWY and really close to SF Airport. Place is clean, quite, free parking and free breakfast. It cost me about $100 per night for 2 adults and 2 kids. I figure it's a great price since breakfast is included for all of us.
reviews.title: Great deal!

reviews.text: Hope this helps!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.text: We spent the night of September 9, 2009 and enjoyed it more than our first time in 2007. When we checked in, I asked if THIS TIME we could get a room that didn't have a couch so stained we were afraid sit on it AND a bathroom with toiletries which were more than half full and where the wallpaper wasn't peeling off the walls. She looked horrified and said, "Oh, my yes! You should have complained before!" We are Choice Hotels club members and were given a nice queen bed suite as nice and CLEAN as could be! Full bottles of toiletries this time, no peeling wallpaper, no stains on the furniture and upgraded linens too!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the positive ratings given by others for the quality of the rooms, however I will never stay here again given my experience with the shuttle from the airport. I had to wait a full hour for the shuttle to arrive in the pickup area at SFO. During this time I made repeated calls to the shuttle operator (JNJ), and was told that the shuttle "runs every 20 minutes and will be there shortly". Don't believe it! And once I was on the shuttle, it took an additional 30 minutes to get to the hotel (I could have driven there in 10). The shuttle services multiple hotels, and we traveled to 5 or 6 different ones over a fairly large area before finally arriving at our destination.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, TERRIBLE Shuttle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conclusion - nice place to stay if you're traveling in a car, but if you're planning to use their shuttle I suggest that you look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Quality place to stay by SFO

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Quality Inn was very clean and had a great breakfast. Desk person Nina was very helpful. Highly recommend if you need a place close to SF airport.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: This is a little gem of a place. It's really close to the airport. A courtesy shuttle does pickups and drop offs at the airport. The room was very spacious and was well kitted out with a fridge, microwave, sofa, coffee table, multi-channel tv. The bathroom was very basic but spotlessly clean. There's a lovely restaurant close by called Houlihans - great value meals and cocktails. The only criticism I have is that a couple came down to breakfast in their pajamas, maybe the hotel should put up a sign or something to deter this lazy behaviour from guests.
reviews.title: the hotel room from hell

reviews.text: after arriving from a coast to coast flight I went to the shuttle courtesy area. I proceeded to phone the number, after waiting an hour the shuttle showed up. After arriving and checking in I was assigned a room directly across from the elevator. I requested another room and was given it. When I finally went to sleep, the quilt and bed sheets were soaking wet. Proceeded to front desk whereupon they gave me dry sheets and said I had to make up the bed because there was no housekeeping on duty.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: I went there with a park and ride package, I was traveling to Europe for 10 days. I let the car and I think the price was OK. The suite was clean and the receptionist was nice. My room was in the first floor above the Taco Bell drive throught, but we didn´t notice any noise. The breakfast was really nice, just done for you.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with parking package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next day we got the shuttle to the airport, fast and profesional.
reviews.title: Well-priced, clean hotel for park and fly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the 18th before a trip to Hawaii. For the price, we were quite pleased with how clean and reasonably well-appointed it was. The front desk was training a new employee, so the check-in was a little choppy, but the people working there were nice and accommodating. Room was clean with a comfortable (on the firmer side) bed, a couch, coffee table, TV and desk. Noise from outside was minimal (noise from inside...see below)
reviews.title: Just what we needed before our flight

reviews.text: The breakfast was ok- we must have been there at the wrong time because there were no eggs, but there were muffins, toast,...standard stuff. It's true that there aren't any restaurants within walking distance, but downtown South San Francisco was just a quick 2-minute drive away with several Italian/pizza places, sushi, and Thai restaurants.
reviews.title: Wonderful small hotel!

reviews.text: Only complaint is that despite the hotel being far from full, they stuck us right next to another couple who were smoking pot a good portion of the evening and....for lack of a better term....we have good reason to believe they were rabbits.
reviews.title: Review of Quality Inn San Francisco International Airport

reviews.text: I was on the Peninsula looking for a nice inexpensive hotel while selling my mothers home. The reviews on this hotel initially caught my eye. From the outside the Quality Inn is nothing special a made over three story hotel with forty five rooms on busy Airport Boulevard next to the SF Airport. There is a COSTCO immediately across the street. The rooms are small but exceptionally clean. My bed was comfortable and despite the roar of 101 nearby I slept very well and the noise didnt bother me. The room had a new fridge, microwave and one of the newer coffee pots that use the small cartridges. The only problem was that the remote on the TV is somewhat difficult to use. What set this hotel apart from others was the exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. When i was exercising in the fitness center Mr Patel came in and checked on me to make sure I had enough air. He brought in an additonal fan to cool me off. He and the night manager were very helpful and answered all my questions. The breakfast in the morning consisted of the usuals but they threw in scrambled eggs and sausages as well. The cost of the room was just under $ 55 for a single queen, a real bargain.
reviews.title: Basic Hotel But With Exceptional Management
Great "park and fly" for SFO
reviews.text: This is a excellent value when flying from SFO. We arrived 12/19, left our car and was quickly taken to the airport. When we returned 12/31 we waited 15 minutes for the shuttle to take us back to the hotel. What we thought was a standard room turned out to be a mini-suite! Next morning, the continental breakfast also was beyond our expectations as it also included waffles, eggs, and sausage. When we checked out, Mr Patel, the manager, even helped us to carry our bags to the car.
I have stayed here several times both for work and fun. The price is a good value relative to other hotels of this quality in San Francisco. Typical chain hotel experience... in a good way.
reviews.title: nice service, convenient location... if you have a car or motorcycle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For travelers with their own transportation. This is a great location to call home for a few days... close to downtown and just off Hwy101. Shopping and good restaurants is less than 5 min. drive away in Milbrae. Though without your own vehicle this place is really only good as an overnite before a flight. Public transit is not easily accessible. Taxis into the city is expensive.
reviews.title: Clean. Economical. Kind Owners, Personally Drove us to the BART Station

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I needed a place to stay overnight near BART to travel into the city the next day and stumbled across this place. Extremely clean rooms, helpful and flexible help at the desk, clean breakfast (yogurts, fruits, pancakes, juices) and our favorite part:
reviews.title: great

aka: Quality Inn & Suites -- South San Francisco Hotel
description: Welcome to the Quality Inn & Suites, a South San Francisco hotel near the San Francisco International Airport. The Quality Inn & SuitesTM hotel is ideally located minutes from famous downtown San Francisco attractions like Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge. Business travelers will appreciate conveniences like large work desks, data port telephones and access to copy and fax services.
